Authors:
Santhiti Vadthanarat, Roy E. Halling, Mario Amalfi,
Saisamorn Lumyong, Olivier Raspe
Title:
High diversity of Sutorius (Boletaceae) from Northern and
Northeastern Thailand
Keywords:
Boletales, Diversity, eight new taxa, Pulveroboletus
group, Taxonomy
Abstract:
Sutorius is a poroid genus in Boletaceae that typically
has chocolate brown to reddish brown or purplish brown basidiomata with
a finely scaly stipe and produces a reddish-brown spore deposit. During
the survey on diversity of boletes in northern and northeastern
Thailand, several Sutorius collections were obtained. Combined evidence
from morphology and phylogenetic analyses of a three-genes data set
(atp6, tef1 and rpb2) of the Sutorius collections along with selected
Boletaceae in the Pulveroboletus group indicated that Thai collections
represent seven new Sutorius species.
